item.title: Elevators
item.description: code on github This week I learned about a new app for Androids: phyPhox. It was shown to me by a friend from work. It was in a context of measuring the speed of elevators in buildings… First things first - it allows to measure and log values from phones sensors - pressure, accelerometer, gyro, magnetometers, GPS, sound (amplitude, frequency). It’s a quite well written app. So, I have a super slow elevator in my building, where I live.
